name: Travelodge Inn & Suites Anaheim

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in Feb 04 while on vacation in Disneyland. This was a Best Western hotel when we stayed there. I work at a Best Western so I at least expected it to be clean. As soon as we walked in to our room I was on the phone trying to get a different hotel. Unfortunately, everybody was full. There were picture hooks hanging on the walls, but no pictures! There were only 3 channels on the T.V. that were in English. The breakfast was served in a train car which sounded like a cute idea but the train car smelled like it hadn't been cleaned since the day it stopped operating. My keys didn't work, and the desk staff told me it was because it was raining outside!!! And I work at a front desk, so I told them that was ridiculous. The 3rd night there was a huge rainstorm and water poured out of the bathroom light fixture. This hotel has since LOST its Best Western branding, that is why its now a Travelodge! Worst hotel I have ever been in!!!
reviews.title: Turn Back! EWWWWWWW
It was just great
reviews.text: From start to finish our stay was great. The front desk person was very friendly. Asking how our drive was, were the kids excited to go to Disneyland. He checked us in very fast and was extremely helpful. Even though the property is older it was clean and looked to be recently renovated. The rooms were spacious and clean. One of the best parts was the black light. You turn it on at night turn the lights off and Presto! You have glow in the dark stars to look at while you drift off to sleep. My boys LOVED it! The Continental Breakfast was standard and in a temporary room while they are building a breakfast room. Housekeeping kept our rooms clean!! Easy in and easy out to the parking structure at Disneyland Resort, another plus when leaving after a long day at the park. Didn't get to use the pool it was too chilly, but it looked clean. We will stay here again !!!

reviews.title: Great deal in an expensive town.
reviews.text: Hey when the breakfast place down the street wants $8 for a glass of Orange Juice this place is an absolute deal. Free breakfast, close to the park and great view of the fireworks at night, better than inside Disneyland. I'm glad I stayed here and saved money. The rooms with glow in the dark stars are great, I don't know what the complaints are about.

reviews.title: flooded out
reviews.text: This place is alright for it's purpose to sleep and shower. We were sent to this hotel for one night because the hotel we had booked, had overbooked and didn't have a room for us upon our arrival. So we were upset but the front desk person at the other hotel said what a nice place this would be. Everyhting was fine, except for a very uncomfortable sofa bed, up until the next morning when my bf's mom went to take a shower and the ceiling started leaking throught the light fixture. It was pretty bad and the floor was flooded. You couldn't even use the toilet as that is where the leaking was going We called the front desk and they sent someone but it took him about 20 minutes to actually arrive. We all wanted to shower, but what could we do? He came in and looked at the place, then fiddled with a few things and left. We called front desk again and eventually he came back. Well, I marched right over to front desk to get a room to shower in and they promptly got us one. I would say this place is not bad. The bathroom incident was a freak thing that could've happened anywhere. The maintenance person should've been a little better and quicker because we lost 2 hours in the park that day. A friend once stayed at the Sheraton, not far from Disneyland, and the toilet broke and flooded the room. These things happen. had we been staying for more than one night, I would've asked for a new room , though.

reviews.title: Great Place & very reasonable
reviews.text: I read all the reviews for this hotel before we left & was very nervous that we would be staying in a real dive. However it was quit the oppisite. The room was clean, pool was fine, and staff was very helpful & polite. There is much to do while you visit Anheim I'm not sure why you want to stay in a 5 star hotel as we were only in our room for 6 hours at night to sleep, then shower& then we were off for the day. This hotel is only 3 minutes from the free tram, and then you are at Disney in another 3 minutes, can't beat that. The hotels on the side of the front entrance have to walk or pay for transportation $3.00 aday per person. I would recomend this hotel to anyone. Those of you that complain I don't think you'd be happy at any hotel.

I dealt with the morning and evening staff and they were all very helpful with anything we needed. The rooms were clean, a good size, nothing fancy, but then again we spent most of our time out of the room. The beds weren't feather beds but after a long day at Disney it didn't take much to get us to sleep. The room had a nice size refrigerator and it came with a microwave. We had a room with a view of the pool. We enjoyed the hot tub and pool during the evenings and morning hours. Continental breakfast was light, but filling. You get a little more than just coffee/juice and donuts. You could walk to disneyland, but after being there nearly 12 hrs. I'm glad we pd the $10 to park at the Disney parking lots. You can also see the fireworks from Disney on Friday's and Saturday's. Take advantage and step outside to view them. We saw them from the pool. We also enjoyed Medieval Times, The Beach and Disney Outlet Store. The drive wasn't too far or difficult to get there.
reviews.title: Great, for the price :-)

reviews.text: I had a good experience, and would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to friends.
reviews.title: We loved the stars!

likes.liked: — The stars on the ceiling and location

reviews.text: We were nicely impressed with this hotel. We were trying to go to Disneyland on a budget which is not easy. This room was a very reasonable price and the rooms were quite large. They were clean and quiet. The staff was friendly and the breakfast was OK. The pool was large and clean. It was the perfect temperature when it had been 85 degrees all day. The beds were comfortable. The best part of the room is the stars on the ceiling. I read this in a review so I looked for them. Turn on the black light for a while and then turn off all the lights. It was like sleeping outside under the stars. Our whole family enjoyed this. Our only negative thing would be the refrigerator did not work too well. Also, it says it is only a block from Disneyland but you have to walk across the street, down a block, over a bridge, across the street again and across a large parking lot to the Disney tram. Maybe it sounds like a quick ten minute walk, but at 11:00 pm after walking all over Disneyland, it seems like 10 miles! I would suggest spending the $10 to park in the Disney garage.
reviews.title: Great location for Disneyland ... OK hotel
Great Value
reviews.text: Advantages of this hotel include its proximity to Disneyland and its rates.

reviews.title: Great Value, definately not the Four Seasons
reviews.text: Our first assigned room (#126) was at the back of the hotel, and was very old, and dirty with an unpleasant musty odour. Even though it was supposed to be a non-smoking room, it did not seem like that at all. We requested another room and were given a newer room that was more pleasant. Note that the room was still older and not the cleanest.

We stayed at the Travelodge Anaheim at Disneyland Drive, located on Ball Road. This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel, and we LOVE it!! The front desk staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and quiet, the pool is large, clean and refreshing, while the jacuzzi is perfect for relaxing after a long day at the park.
reviews.title: Super Location and Staff

likes.liked: — Location. Near to Disneyland, yet far enough away to be quiet and peaceful
likes.disliked: — Could only get a smoking room, nonsmoking rooms with 2 beds were sold out.

reviews.text: Walking to the entrance of the park is quite a long way, but only about 2 long blocks from the hotel to the Disney shuttle pick up site at the parking garage. Shuttle is free to Downtown Disney near the entrance to the 2 parks and runs often. Parking is expensive at Disney, but plenty of free parking at the hotel so you can leave your car and walk those 2 blocks.
reviews.title: Close to Disney but far from restaurants

likes.liked: — It was very close to Disneyland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At night the view of the fireworks was phenomenal!! Go up on the walkway on the third floor and you have a pretty much unobstructed view.
reviews.title: Great value - above average roadside motorlodge facility

reviews.text: I will stay here every time I go to Disneyland and would absolutely recommend it to friends. (I already have!)
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: We booked into this hotel for being close to Disney and for the price. It was close, and it was cheap, thats true, but the room was a bit depressive. First the bathrooms bathtub had been removed, and it had tiles instead (diffenrent tiles from the rest of the room). The shower height was too low, at chest height, so you had to bend to have water in your head. There were no resturants nearby, unless you drive. We saw the other Travelodges in the area, and they were close to Dennys and IHOP and convenience stores, but not this one. At first we couldnt find the way to the Disney entrance, because you have to go above a freeway, and because we have bad orientation. But
reviews.title: Good value for money
Dissapointed - Not a good option for family
reviews.text: We stayed in the Family suite becuase we have four children. Our room #223 had one window near the hide - a - bed that didn't do much to light the dark stuffy room. When we did open the window, smoke from somone in the pool area drifted in forcing us to close the window. After bathing the children, I noticed their feet were black. I realized how dirty the carpet was. It wasn't too noticable at first because it was dark carpet in a dark room. We didn't return for the 'hot breakfast' but danishes were ok. The staffing in the train cars did need help to empty the trash cans and wipe off the tables. We did get someone to replace the broken inside door latch so we could keep the 2 year old from opening the door at will and wandering off.

reviews.title: Very Good Experience for Us!
reviews.text: Generally, a dirty old motel. The black light and stars on the ceiling were just there to try and take your mind of the rest of the problems.

reviews.title: Gross!!
reviews.text: I was pleased with our very large room with 2 queen beds and air conditioning. The beds were firm, comfortable, and a welcome respite after spending 13 hours at Disneyland on a Saturday. It was close to the park (within 1-1/2 block's distance to the "Mickey & Friends" parking structure from where we could catch the Disney tram to the front of both Disneyland & Calif Adventure). The staff at the front desk was helpful and gave us extra coffee filters, cream/sugar, etc. for our room. The complimentary breakfast was not fancy, but fine with us, and included coffee, eggs, bacon & toast, and pastries. Also, it was fun that the ceiling would "glow" with stars and the milky way once the lights were turned off at night. It was convenient to have a filling station next door to the hotel which also included an AM/PM market attached.

reviews.title: Good budget hotel
reviews.text: Back in June 2004, my boyfriend and I stayed here because we wanted a good night's rest before spending an entire day at Disneyland. In terms of location, this hotel is not bad, but that's about the only thing this hotel offers! Our room smelled a little funky (mold perhaps?) and the sheets were not clean at all -- my skin got itchy the next day. The room came with a fridge and microwave, but unfortunately, none of them worked. There's hardly any restaurants near this hotel. The area didn't look too safe. I would not recommend this hotel at all! You're better off going a bit far from Disneyland and get a better deal.

reviews.title: Roches------Raid please * do not turn on the light
reviews.text: Read all of the reviews and decided to give it a go. I will tell you that a lot of the reviews I read must have been written by a guest with a "grudge". The hotel is nothing too fancy but it's only a 2 star so what can you expect. If you want luxary stay at the Disneyland hotels or at the Hilton. The place was clean, cheap, and they had a decent size pool. The breakfast wasn't the best in the world but totally free so that helped us. The staff told me they were going to be remodeling soon, that is good cuz it does look a little "old". All in all a good trip and I would stay here again[.

description: Travelodge Anaheim on Disneyland Drive is located within walking distance of the Disneyland Resort which includes Disneyland, Disney’s California Adventure and the Downtown Disney District. Conveniently located off the 5 freeway.Enjoy convenient access to all popular attractions, including Knotts Berry Farm, Laguna and Newport Beaches, and South Coast Plaza for shopping, movie theaters, and restaurants.Located nearby the Travelodge Anaheim hotel / motel, is the home field of the Anaheim Angels as well as the famous Arrowhead Pond Arena.Our Anaheim hotel boasts a first class view of the Disneyland fireworks display, you can relax and enjoy the typical Southern California weather beside the full sized outdoor heated pool or take a moment to pamper yourself in the spa tub. Travelodge Anaheim is the ideal rest stop for a long journey or for a central place when visiting southern California.Our friendly and hospitable staffs are experts in pointing you in the right direction, whether you are looking for Anaheim attractions, a tour, a golden beach, or something different to eat. Drop by the front desk and let them do the research for you. Everyone at the Travelodge Anaheim looks forward to welcoming all of its guests.
